intro: Chaetaria laevis, commonly known as the smooth chaetaria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in meadows or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, contributing to its common name. Chaetaria laevis is noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
